sub_topic: Calculation of heat capacity of a substance
message_1: Calculate the heat capacity of 50g of water when its temperature is raised from 25°C to 65°C.
message_2:
To calculate the heat capacity of water, we can use the formula:

q = mcΔT

where:
q = heat capacity (Joules)
m = mass of water (grams)
c = specific heat capacity of water (4.18 J/g°C)
ΔT = change in temperature (°C)

Given:
m = 50 g
ΔT = 65°C - 25°C = 40°C
c = 4.18 J/g°C

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

q = (50 g) × (4.18 J/g°C) × (40°C)

q = 50 × 4.18 × 40

q = 8376 Joules

The heat capacity of 50g of water when its temperature is raised from 25°C to 65°C is 8376 Joules.
